head.citation-title: Comparative and functional genomics of malaria parasites
head.abstracts: © 2017 John Wiley & Sons, Inc.Genomics is the study of the genome of a cell or an organism, including efforts to determine the entire DNA sequence of an organism and fine-scale genetic mapping. Comparative genomics is the study of diversity and divergence among the genomes of individuals (population genomics) or among species to reveal evolutionary history of a taxonomic group and to discover features unique to a particular lineage or species. Functional genomics may include studies of gene functions and gene expression regulation, including genome-wide analyses of mRNA and non-coding RNA, protein expression, products of cellular metabolism, DNA methylation and histone modification, interaction of an individual's genome with drugs, and genome-wide association studies (GWAS), or linkage analysis to identify genetic variations linked to biologic traits or phenotypes. This chapter summarizes some of the major recent advances in the genomics of malaria parasites, with emphasis on comparative studies and functional genomics of the malaria parasite Plasmodium falciparum.

coredata.dc:description: Genomics is the study of the genome of a cell or an organism, including efforts to determine the entire DNA sequence of an organism and fine-scale genetic mapping. Comparative genomics is the study of diversity and divergence among the genomes of individuals (population genomics) or among species to reveal evolutionary history of a taxonomic group and to discover features unique to a particular lineage or species. Functional genomics may include studies of gene functions and gene expression regulation, including genome-wide analyses of mRNA and non-coding RNA, protein expression, products of cellular metabolism, DNA methylation and histone modification, interaction of an individual's genome with drugs, and genome-wide association studies (GWAS), or linkage analysis to identify genetic variations linked to biologic traits or phenotypes. This chapter summarizes some of the major recent advances in the genomics of malaria parasites, with emphasis on comparative studies and functional genomics of the malaria parasite Plasmodium falciparum.
coredata.dc:title: Comparative and functional genomics of malaria parasites
